resources.string: Full or partially full plastic bottles
CNMâ€™s overarching Sustainability goal is to reduce waste, water use, energy use, and carbon emissions while educating the CNM community about sustainable practices.
Click the recycle icon in the navigation menu below to learn more about recycling, or click on the house with a water droplet to learn more about water conservation.

Single-stream recycling is an all-in-one recycling method where materials can be combined into one single bin. CNM has blue single-stream recycling bins located next to the trash cans in most classrooms and large green cardboard recycling bins have been placed in common areas across all campuses.
Click the button below to see a list of trash items. Try and guess if the item is recyclable or not. Then click on the item to see if you were right.

It\'s no secret that one way we can all help the environment is by conserving the amount of water we use everyday. The first step to reducing our water usage is understanding how much water everyday activities use.
Click the button below to view a calculator that will show you how many gallons of water different faucets in your home use per minute.
Can go in the recycle bins!
